title: Science Education Design Utilizing MOOC-based Flipped Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic scientific concepts and experimental methods
context.additional_context: Active learning and flipped learning-based science education curriculum conducted in a smartphone-centric, limited technological environment. Pre-learning using MOOC content is followed by real-time/asynchronous discussions and application activities.

learning_goals: Learners can watch science concept videos provided on MOOC platforms and summarize/explain key content.
Learners can apply scientific theories to real-world cases through online discussions with peers in a flipped learning environment.
Learners can achieve over 80% accuracy in quizzes and formative assessments based on MOOC content using mobile devices.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
